_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Tank, pumps, hoses guages, valves, piping

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

We at the North Central Grain Cooperative are strongly committed to employee, public, and

environmental safety. This commitment is an inherent part of our comprehensive Accidental Release

Prevention Program that covers areas such as (but, not limited to)design, installation, operating

procedures, maintenance, and employee training, all associated with the processes at our facility. It

is our policy to implement the appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated

substances. We also coordinate our response efforts with the local Fire Department, Law

Enforcement, and Emergency Medical Services, all which provide additional emergency response

information and expertise.

2. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:

Our facility's primary activities include support services for agricultural crop production. We have

anhydrous ammonia stored at our facility, in both a primary holding tank(s), as well as supplemental

nurse tanks, which are used for product field application. All of our tanks are filled by skilled, trained

employees who do not fill any tank beyond the 85% standard maximum storage capacity.

3. Worst Case Release and Alternative Release Scenarios:

(NOTE: #3 Available only to County Emergency Manager, Fire Department and North Central Grain

Cooperative - not included with disk to EPA for public access per Federal Regulation posted 2004)

4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program :

Our facility has taken the necessary steps to comply with the EPA's accidental release prevention

requirements as set forth in 40 CFR part 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of

the release prevention program that is in place at our stationary source:

Process Safety Information:

North Central Grain Cooperative maintains a current and detailed data base of safety information

that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment d

esigns associated with

all processes.

Process Hazard Analysis:

Our facility conducts routine, comprehensive studies to ensure all hazards that maybe associated

with our processes are identified and controlled effectively. Any findings from the hazard analysis are

addressed in a timely manner.

Operating Procedures:

North Central Grain Cooperative maintains strict written operating procedures to ensure that

activities within our covered processes are conducted safely. These procedures address various

modes of operation; the information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to all operators

involved in the processes.

Training:

North Central Grain Cooperative has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that all

employees who are involved with operating processes and procedures are competent in the

operating procedures associated with these processes.

Mechanical Integrity:

North Central Grain Cooperative conducts regular, documented maintenance checks on all process

equipment to ensure safe, proper operation. Maintenance checks are conducted by qualified

personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Examples of process equipment that

would receive maintenance checks include: pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief

and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps. Any equipment deficiencies

identified by the maintenance checks are taken out of service and corrected in a safe and timely

manner.

Management of Change:

Written procedures are in place at North Central Grain Cooperative to manage changes in process

chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Process operators, maintenance personnel

and/or other employees whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are

promptly notified of the modification and receive updated training to deal with it.

Pre-startup Reviews:

North Central Grain Cooperative routinely conducts pre-startup safety reviews rela

ted to new

processes and modifications in established processes. These reviews are conducted to confirm that

construction, equipment, and operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup

prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits:

North Central Grain Cooperative conducts compliance audits on a regular basis to determine

whether the plan's provisions, set out under the 40 CFR part 68, are being implemented. Any noncompliance

issue discovered during the audit is promptly noted and immediately corrected.

Employee Participation:

North Central Grain Cooperative truly believes that process safety management and accident

prevention is a team effort. Company employees are strongly encouraged to express their views

concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our

employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP,

particularly information resulting from process hazard analyses.

5. Five-year Accident History:

North Central Grain Cooperative has had an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over

the last 5 years. Due to our stringent release prevention policies, no accidental release has occurred

during this period.

6. Emergency Response Plan:

North Central Grain Cooperative maintains a written Emergency Action Plan to deal with accidental

releases of hazardous materials. The plan addresses all aspects of emergency response including

first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and, in the event of an accidental release, North

Central Grain Cooperative will contact local emergency response agencies and the public. North

Central Grain Cooperative maintains a written Emergency Action Plan which is coordinated with the

local Fire Department and the county's Emergency Manager. The plan is intended to assist

responding agencies to address all aspects of emergency response including first aid and medical

treatment, evacuati

ons, and notification of other local emergency response agencies and the public.

The Fire Department conducts regular, routine training sessions at this location assisted by our

facility personnel.

7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

North Central Grain Cooperative will continue to provide our employees with currant and ongoing

annual training (and more frequently, if necessary) to ensure that they are up-to-date with all of the

safe anhydrous ammonia transfer and handling procedures, all Federal, State, Regional, and Local

regulations that may apply, as well as provide regular inspection and maintenance on all of the

ammonia equipment. Only authorized personnel (authorized by management) will make changes to

the facility if any audits of the facility identify non-compliance with Section 112 (r)(7), Accidental

Release Prevention Requirements of the Clean Air Act.
